alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 11:24AM CST until March 08 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning, March 3rd, and continue rising to a crest of 30.0 feet early Sunday morning, March 5th. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening, the 6th. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 22.8 Thu 10 AM 26.0 29.7 29.2 30.0 12 AM 3/05 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
